stories.text:
I’ve started up a new job which requires the use of a windows desktop station, which is a big shift.

I’m most familiar with macOS and have loved using tools like: - moom (window management) - native screen capture hotkeys - keyboard maestro (actions/macros) - typinator (text snippet expansion) - hazel (file management)

What are the best tools for automation you’ve encountered on windows for speeding up your day to day?
stories.title: Ask HN: What are the best automation tools on Windows?
